definitions.definition: the action of firing several guns at the same time, either in a war or in a ceremony:
a sudden loud sound made by many people at the same time:
examples: Every joke the comedian made was greeted by a salvo of laughter from the audience.

definitions.definition: the first part of a speech or the first in a series of actions intended to get a particular result:
examples: In his opening salvo the speaker fiercely attacked the government's record on healthcare.
